instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: I have got two 820-3476 where the keyboard and trackpad randomly starts and stops working. Pretty sure they are not recognized as USB devices when this happens. Keyboard controller?

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Nah, Inspect for corrosion on flatcable/connector to trackpad first.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Looks good, testing with known good cable.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Connect a known good trackpad+cable to the board. This boards will freak out if there is no trackpad connected and the KB and TP will go on/off. Pretty sure this will be a bad TP or cable/corrosion.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Yea, I have definitely tested this in two good whole top cases. What if they aren't being detected as USB devices in system info? Because that may be a possibility for one of them.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: That is what they do if the trackpad is not working properly. USB cuts in and out. Inspect for liquid damage and corrosion again.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message:
I left this alone until now, and it seems to have gotten worse while sitting. It works fine when the IO board flex cable is unplugged. Once I plugged the IO board in, it does the following:
[LIST]
[*]I can hold the option key to get to the boot menu, however once I get to the boot menu the internal keyboard/trackpad stop responding (caps lock key does not even light up). A USB keyboard works fine.
[*]It will hang at the Apple logo when it tries to boot. No loading bar or anything.
[/LIST] PCH??

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Have you tried a good IO board and cable?

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Also another or without the airport card?

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Without the airport card it works fine.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: No it works in another system and a second card causes the same thing.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Does airport and BT work when in OSX?

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Not sure how to test that. Should I boot it up and then just pop the airport card in while it's on? I thought airport is PCIe.

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: Uhm, what is preventing boot up with the APX installed?

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message:
This: 

[QUOTE="arghhh, post: 10586"]I left this alone until now, and it seems to have gotten worse while sitting. It works fine when the IO board flex cable is unplugged. Once I plugged the IO board in, it does the following:
[LIST]
[*]I can hold the option key to get to the boot menu, however once I get to the boot menu the internal keyboard/trackpad stop responding (caps lock key does not even light up). A USB keyboard works fine.
[*][COLOR=#FF0000][B]It will hang at the Apple logo when it tries to boot. No loading bar or anything.[/B][/COLOR]
[/LIST] PCH??[/QUOTE]

10 char

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message:
Oh yeah. Hmm, you can disable BT by removing U3510 and disable APX by removing L9501. See if it is BT or APX causing the issue.

You saud you have 2 boards, both the exact same issue?

threads.title: 820-3476 keyboard/trackpad cuts in and out
threads.message: No, I sent one of them back no fix but I can't remember which one unfortunately, sorry.
